game

Class ZombieMovement

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • game.GameObject
            • game.ZombieMovement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ZombieType

    public class ZombieMovement
extends GameObject
    The class that controls the functionality of the zombie movements. Also known as the AI for the enemy, detects the fastest path to get from the enemy's location to the player's location.
    Author:
    Stefan Mitic, Alex Chan, Sowon Ham
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      This method should be implemented to provide a behavior for this object.
      void adjustments()
      The method for where it controls the adjustments when certain corner areas are hit by zombies.
      void directionDecision()
      The method for where it contains many switch statements detecting the player quadrant and zombie quadrant to figure out which would be the fastest route for the zombie to take to reach the player (the map is separated into 9 quadrants).
      void downRecoil()
      The method for setting up the recoil going downwards when the zombies are hit.
      void entityLocation()
      The method for where it detects the entity location in the game separated by quadrants.
      boolean horizontalWallCollision()
      The method for where it detects if the zombies are collided with the horizontal walls.

      The method for setting up the recoil going left when the zombies are hit.
      void movement()
      The method for where it controls the actual movement for the zombies (speed).

      The method for where the zombies move to the bottom right and then resets.

      The method for where the zombies move to the left entrance and then resets.

      • act

        public void act()
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        This method should be implemented to provide a behavior for this object. The Game will automatically call this method every millisecond. It can be implemented to provide basic behavior for an object, such as movement.
        Specified by:
        act in class GameObject

        public void moveToTopLeft()
        The method for where the zombies move to the top left and then resets. This coordinate is to an imagenary point that allows the zombies to avoid collision with the walls.
